main event: Multiple UFO sightings occurred at Pepperrell AFB, Newfoundland in 1953, including the observation of a small unidentified flying object and a green object resembling the landing light on an aircraft.
interesting points: Sightings included observations of green objects emitting sparks and traveling downward at high speeds, disappearing behind the horizon. The object was similar in appearance to the moon.
No radar contact was made, and the weather conditions at the time were generally good, ruling out natural atmospheric phenomena as the cause of the sightings.
Observations were made by credible Air Force personnel, including a major, enlisted personnel, and a pilot of an incoming aircraft, adding weight to the credibility of the reports.

The conclusion of the incidents varied, with possibilities ranging from a small unidentified flying object to overestimated meteors or bright stars shining low on the horizon, indicating the complexity in identifying the objects.
Photographs were not included in the report, leaving the sightings based solely on eyewitness accounts and lacking tangible evidence.
sighted object: small unidentified flying object and a green object resembling the landing light on an aircraft
witnesses: US Air Force personnel including a major, enlisted personnel, and a pilot
